body_html:
So, I followed the steps (except that I used openjdk) and it worked for me. It built using gcc, though, as it should from the Dockerfile. But your error points to clang-3.6.

(Note that if you want to use ccache, you have to use -v :/root/.ccache and create a gcc, g++ script.)
body_text:
So, I followed the steps (except that I used openjdk) and it worked for me.  It built using gcc, though, as it should from the Dockerfile. But your error points to clang-3.6.
(Note that if you want to use ccache, you have to use -v :/root/.ccache and create a gcc, g++ script.)
body:
So, I followed the steps (except that I used openjdk) and it worked for me.  It built using gcc, though, as it should from the Dockerfile. But your error points to clang-3.6.

(Note that if you want to use ccache, you have to use -v <somedir>:/root/.ccache and create a gcc, g++ script.)
